Rope the Mark.name: Rope the Mark
Rope the Mark.flavor: Making yourself appear vulnerable lures your enemy into danger.
Rope the Mark.effect: Before the attack, you shift 1 square to a square with no adjacent enemies.
Rope the Mark.target: One creature that can see and hear you
Rope the Mark.attack:
Primary ability + 6 vs. Will
Level 21: Primary ability + 9 vs. Will
Rope the Mark.onHit: You pull the target 5 squares. Additionally, choose one of the following: Either you make an at-will melee attack with combat advantage against the target, or one or two of your allies can make ranged basic attacks against the target as free actions.

Unwitting Ally.name: Unwitting Ally
Unwitting Ally.flavor: Careful manipulation and patience turns an enemy into your dupe.
Unwitting Ally.target: One enemy that can see and hear you
Unwitting Ally.onHit: The target makes an attack as a free action against an enemy adjacent to it with an at-will attack power of your choice.
Unwitting Ally.requirement: The power Unwitting Ally must be active in order to use this power.

Convincing Deception.name: Convincing Deception
Convincing Deception.flavor: You spew a stream of prattle to give your allies the opening they need.
Convincing Deception.target: One enemy in the burst you can see
Convincing Deception.effect: The target grants combat advantage to one ally in the burst until the end of your next turn. In addition, a different ally in the burst can shift 3 squares to a square adjacent to the target as a free action.
